result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on March 24, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on March 30, 2023 at 08:00 am.

2:02 PM CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, Attorney Karl E Anderson in court for State of Wisconsin, Defendant Kelvin Jackson in court, Attorney Warren Lee Brandt in court for Kelvin Jackson. INCLUDES 22CF84, 20CF624, 20CF720, 21CF49 and 22CF216. Court sets JT and FPT in 20CF624, all other cases to trail. Court notes settlement deadline. Atty. Brandt requests bond modification 22CF216. Court will not modify bond at this time, would like to see 60 days of clean tests. Atty. Brandt may file motion to modify bond after information from JSC has been received that DE has 60 days of clean tests.  Adjourned: 2:10 PM. kma
Status conference on October 28, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

3:55 PM CO: R. Smeltzer for SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: S. Fox, Attorney Warren Lee Brandt in court for Kelvin NMI Jackson via zoom.  Attorney Karl E Anderson in court for State of Wisconsin via zoom. Defendant Kelvin NMI Jackson appeared by zoom. Includes 20CF624, 22CF84, 20CF720, 21CF49 and 22CF216. Court reviews right to appear in person for today's hearing with def. DA Karl E Anderson requests to continue trial due to sickness. Atty Brandt agrees to postpone the jury trial under the circumstances. Court removes jury trial from calendar.
Status conference scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

10:24 AM CO: Nordstrand, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: K Kittel.  District Attorney Karl E Anderson in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Warren Lee Brandt in court for w/Defendant Kelvin NMI Jackson.  INCLUDES:  20CF624 (FPT), 22CF84, 20CF720, 21CF49, and 22CF216 (all STC). Attys state no resolution. State has standard MIL's that were filed prior to previous JT. Attys may stipulate to an offer of proof as to exhibits to shorten the witness list. State has filed six MIL's.  Off record review of MIL's at 10:40 am. Back on at 10:42 am. Atty Brandt states his objections to MIL #2. DA  Anderson responds. Atty Brandt argues. Attys to file Briefs as to #2 no later than 10/7. Court will issue a written decision. Atty Brand to file exhibit list by 10/7. State is also to file a Brief describing the evidence, offer of proof and why not admissible. Atty Brandt to file Brief / Response by Friday. Attys /DE to report at 8:00 am. Judge goes over packets that will be provided to Attys the morning of trial to be reviewed.  One alternate will be selected, Attys each have 4 strikes, will seat 21 jurors. 7 days prior to trial, State is to provide Atty Brandt exactly all electronic evidence that will be shown, to give Atty Brandt time to object. Attys to also Brief as to hearsay as to deceased witness.  Adjourned: 11:08 am

Atty Brandt states his objections to MIL #2. DA  Anderson responds. Atty Brandt argues. Attys to file Briefs as to #2 no later than 10/7. Court will issue a written decision. Atty Brand to file exhibit list by 10/7. State is also to file a Brief describing the evidence, offer of proof and why not admissible. Atty Brandt to file Brief / Response by Friday. Attys /DE to report at 8:00 am. Judge goes over packets that will be provided to Attys the morning of trial to be reviewed.  One alternate will be selected, Attys each have 4 strikes, will seat 21 jurors. 7 days prior to trial, State is to provide Atty Brandt exactly all electronic evidence that will be shown, to give Atty Brandt time to object. Attys to also Brief as to hearsay as to deceased witness.  Adjourned: 11:08 am
Pretrial Bond Report. Filed by JSC. Includes 22CF216,22CF84, 21CF49,20CF720,20CF624. SEALED. kma   to kp

* AMENDED *

$1,000 BOND ON FILE.

-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

-   I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random drug & alcohol testing random ETG testing ONE time per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

to Modify Bond. Filed by Atty Brandt. km    Per SJN, the clerk shall amend the bond as requested. The DE shall report to the clerk's office within 7 days to sign the bond. JA emailed same to Atty Brandt. gll
Clerk notes letter was filed in error in 20CF624 and copied to correct case 22CF216.  gll

CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA: Erica Ellenwood  DF ATTY:  Warren Lee Brandt   DF:  Kelvin NMI Jackson appeared from jail. Case called at 9:28 a.m. Court notes 22CF216 is scheduled for a preliminary hearing. Has a request for a Substitution of Judge filed by Atty Brandt. Atty Brandt after speaking to client will waive preliminary hearing. Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing. DE understands and waives preliminary hearing. Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Court will have a new Judge appointed and arraignment will be scheduled. Atty Brandt requesting a bond modification. ADA Ellenwood does not object. Court will modify bond. Address and phone confirmed. Court adjourned at 9:33 a.m.
